meanings.definition: To take and use (something that belongs to someone else) with the intention of returning it.
meanings.sent1: She borrowed a book from the library and promised to bring it back.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed a pen from my friend during the exam.
meanings.sent3: He borrowed a cup of sugar from his neighbor to make cookies.
meanings.sent4: The student borrowed a brilliant idea from a famous author for his essay.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel borrowed a nut from the pile to store for winter.

meanings.definition: To take and use (money) that will be paid back with interest.
meanings.sent1: My brother borrowed some money from the bank to start his business.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed a small loan from my friend to buy a new phone.
meanings.sent3: She borrowed a dollar from her piggy bank to buy a candy bar.
meanings.sent4: The company borrowed a large sum of money to expand its operations.
meanings.sent5: The ant borrowed a grain of sugar from the ant hill to share with its friends.
